wikipedia_page.main: Steven Clark (born 2 February 1982) is a footballer who plays as a midfielder. He is currently assistant manager at Glebe FC (SCEFL) Premier Division club.Clark started as a trainee with West Ham United before moving to Southend United in 2002 for £50,000. After a season at the club he signed on for another year in June 2003. He was released in May 2004.He had several clubs over a short period of time starting with the demise of what was Hornchurch. After Hornchurch folded, he moved to Dagenham & Redbridge then to Weymouth with various loan spells along the way. Clark then played for Fisher Athletic.

link_mentions.page: West Ham United F.C. Under-23s and Academy

response: * Steven Clark (Australian footballer) (1961–2005), VFL/AFL player for three clubs
* Steven Clarke (gridiron football) (born 1991), Canadian football defensive back

Clark started his football career with Southend United playing in their youth setup, before making his debut replacing Steven Clark as a substitute in the 79minute minute, in the 2–0 away defeat to Kidderminster Harriers in the Third Division on 30 March 2002. He went on to make another two appearances for Southend during the 2001–02 season.
